messages.text:
Some stats about the Julia track and <#C6FGJ8REC|appreciation> for the mentors:

22 people have mentored students on the Julia track in 2020. The median for mentored solutions per mentor is 21, the average is 65.

3 have mentored more than 100 solutions each, with one mentor having mentored 442 (!) solutions.

Mentors provided feedback on more than 1400 submitted solutions in total.

I don't have the names that are attached to the numbers and not everyone publicly lists themselves as mentor, so I can't point out who they are.

messages.text:
I implemented the `ComplexNumber`class as follow:
```struct ComplexNumber{T<:Real} <: Number
    Re::T
    Im::T
    ComplexNumber{T}(Re::Real, Im::Real) where {T} = new{T}(T(Re), T(Im))
    ComplexNumber{T}(Re::Real) where {T} = new{T}(T(Re), zero(Re))
end

Base.:(==)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = a.Re == b.Re && <http://a.Im|a.Im> == <http://b.Im|b.Im>

Base.:(+)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re + b.Re, <http://a.Im|a.Im> + <http://b.Im|b.Im>)
Base.:(+)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a + b.Re, <http://b.Im|b.Im>)

Base.:(-)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re - b.Re, <http://a.Im|a.Im> - <http://b.Im|b.Im>)
Base.:(-)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a - b.Re, <http://b.Im|b.Im>)

Base.:(*)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re * b.Re - <http://a.Im|a.Im> * <http://b.Im|b.Im>, <http://a.Im|a.Im> * b.Re + a.Re * <http://b.Im|b.Im>)
Base.:(*)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a * b.Re, <http://b.Im|b.Im>)

Base.:(/)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber((a.Re * b.Re + <http://a.Im|a.Im> * <http://b.Im|b.Im>)/(b.Re^2+<http://b.Im|b.Im>^2), (<http://a.Im|a.Im> * b.Re - a.Re * <http://b.Im|b.Im>)/(b.Re^2+<http://b.Im|b.Im>^2))
Base.:(/)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a * b.Re / (b.Re^2+<http://b.Im|b.Im>^2), a * <http://b.Im|b.Im> / (b.Re^2+<http://b.Im|b.Im>^2))
Base.:(/)(a::ComplexNumber, b::T) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a.Re / b, <http://a.Im|a.Im> / b)

abs(a::ComplexNumber) = sqrt(a.Re^2+<http://a.Im|a.Im>^2)
conj(a::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re, -<http://a.Im|a.Im>)
real(a::ComplexNumber) = a.Re
imag(a::ComplexNumber) = <http://a.Im|a.Im>```
but when I run it, the error occurred:
```ERROR: LoadError: invalid redefinition of constant ComplexNumber```
why?

elements.text: I implemented the
ComplexNumber
class as follow:

struct ComplexNumber{T<:Real} <: Number
    Re::T
    Im::T
    ComplexNumber{T}(Re::Real, Im::Real) where {T} = new{T}(T(Re), T(Im))
    ComplexNumber{T}(Re::Real) where {T} = new{T}(T(Re), zero(Re))
end

Base.:(==)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = a.Re == b.Re && a.Im == b.Im

Base.:(+)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re + b.Re, a.Im + b.Im)
Base.:(+)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a + b.Re, b.Im)

Base.:(-)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re - b.Re, a.Im - b.Im)
Base.:(-)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a - b.Re, b.Im)

Base.:(*)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re * b.Re - a.Im * b.Im, a.Im * b.Re + a.Re * b.Im)
Base.:(*)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a * b.Re, b.Im)

Base.:(/)(a::ComplexNumber, b::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber((a.Re * b.Re + a.Im * b.Im)/(b.Re^2+b.Im^2), (a.Im * b.Re - a.Re * b.Im)/(b.Re^2+b.Im^2))
Base.:(/)(a::T, b::ComplexNumber) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a * b.Re / (b.Re^2+b.Im^2), a * b.Im / (b.Re^2+b.Im^2))
Base.:(/)(a::ComplexNumber, b::T) where T <: Real = ComplexNumber(a.Re / b, a.Im / b)

abs(a::ComplexNumber) = sqrt(a.Re^2+a.Im^2)
conj(a::ComplexNumber) = ComplexNumber(a.Re, -a.Im)
real(a::ComplexNumber) = a.Re
imag(a::ComplexNumber) = a.Im
but when I run it, the error occurred:
ERROR: LoadError: invalid redefinition of constant ComplexNumber
why?

messages.text: because your REPL already knows a struct with the name "ComplexNumber". I guess you are using VSCode? If so, open up a fresh julia REPL and rerun the code

elements.text: because your REPL already knows a struct with the name "ComplexNumber". I guess you are using VSCode? If so, open up a fresh julia REPL and rerun the code

messages.text:
Status update on v3: <https://twitter.com/exercism_io/status/1354955882283618309#m> (thread)

Exploding a monorepo to 50+ repos is quite something :smile:

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/exercism_io|@exercism_io>: Tonight, as a preliminary step towards launching v3, we've renamed `master` to `main` as our primary branch across 251 reps, and moved over 350 issues from the v3 monorepo into the relevant track repos.

(Both of these jobs were done manually - big thanks to those who helped!!)
attachments.text:
Tonight, as a preliminary step towards launching v3, we've renamed `master` to `main` as our primary branch across 251 reps, and moved over 350 issues from the v3 monorepo into the relevant track repos.

(Both of these jobs were done manually - big thanks to those who helped!!)

messages.text:
Hi, we're writing an exercise on regex for the upcoming Exercism version and could need some help testing it. I find it really hard to estimate how long it would take people to solve, and what parts in particular could cause issues.

I've already asked people who are quite experienced with regex to test it, so I'm mostly looking for people who are newish to using them (but not entirely new). It took the more experienced users ~8-10min on average.

If you have some time to help me out, I'd really appreciate if you could try coming up with an expression that captures the relevant info in the input strings, and let me know how long it took you and if there was anything in particular that caused issues.

Instructions are attached below, here's a regex101 link with test input: <https://regex101.com/r/vBAvfr/1/>

The final result should look roughly like the screenshot:

elements.text:

files.title: instructions.md
files.preview:
# Instructions

You are a stage herald at an international conference.
It's your job to announce speakers, remind them when their time is up, and moderate the Q&A session.
You're given a list of speakers on your stage in advance and need to turn them into moderation cards.
files.preview_highlight:
# Instructions
​
You are a stage herald at an international conference.
It's your job to announce speakers, remind them when their time is up, and moderate the Q&A session.
You're given a list of speakers on your stage in advance and need to turn them into moderation cards.

messages.text: (No need to wrap it in Julia code or anything like that, I'm only curious about the time it takes to write the regex to capture the info)

elements.text: (No need to wrap it in Julia code or anything like that, I'm only curious about the time it takes to write the regex to capture the info)
